title: Ticket #3164: Missing format strings
description:
From Florian Weimer -

I've found several missing format strings, see the attached patches. I'm unsure about the impact.

The patches are against Matt's condor-security tree.

There are further obstacles against switch on -Werror=format-nonliteral:

  • AttrGetName() in condor_utils/condor_attributes.cpp
  • AttrListPrintMask::registerFormat() in condor_utils/ad_printmask.cpp
  • EnvGetName() in condor_utils/condor_environ.cpp
  • writeUsageAd() in condor_utils/condor_event.cpp
  • Condor_Auth_Kerberos::dprintf_krb5_principal() in condor_io/condor_auth_kerberos.cpp
  • SecMan::getSecSetting_implementation() in condor_io/condor_secman.cpp
  • FormatFloat() in condor_tools/user_prio.c (??? this file contains dodgy string handling, including sprintf-to-argument)
  • ViewServer::WriteHistory() in condor_collector.V6/view_server.cpp

Some of those can be worked around (often by using width/precision parameters such as "%*.*f"), but AttrListPrintMask::registerFormat() is exposed on the condor_q, condor_history command line, so it is difficult to retire.
remarks:
2012-Jul-31 15:23:15 by jfrey:
CODE REVIEW

I reviewed the following patches forwarded by Matt. They look good.

  • 0001-HashKey-sprintf-char-remove-dangerous-API.patch
  • 0016-DCMsg-cancelMessage-add-missing-format-string-3164.patch
  • 0017-AddNode-add-missing-format-string-3164.patch
  • 0018-AmazonVMStart-workerFunction-add-missing-format-stri.patch
